did.abstract: The John Lundin papers contain correspondence exchanged during World War II and a publication, "Across the Brooklyn Bridge" by Lundin's son, John Eric Lundin. These letters reveal Lundin's experience as a World War II soldier. John E. Lundin's "Across the Brooklyn Bridge" retells Lundin family history, including details about Lundin's experience as a World War II soldier and an engineering student at the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn (now renamed NYU Tandon School of Engineering).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The John Lundin papers contain correspondence and a publication. Contents include: Several letters exchanged between 1943-1945 and a book, titled "Across the Brooklyn Bridge" by Lundin's son, John Eric Lundin. The collection is 1 linear foot, located on bay 29, shelf 7E.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is housed in one box and is organized into two series: Series I: Correspondence, 1943-1945 and Series II: Publications, 2017. Original order was maintained whenever possible.
